Viewing Folder or Item Properties or References

The View Comparison utility allows you to review the properties or references for child folders or any item currently shown in the item pane. It even displays references in views that are not the source or the target.

To review properties for a child folder or item:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Click a tab on the lower pane to display child folders or items of a specific type.

  4. Select one or more items in the source or the target from the item pane.

  5. Do one of the following:

    • Select Source Item Properties from the Item or context menu, or click the Source Item Properties button on the toolbar.

    • Select Target Item Properties from the Item or context menu, or click the Target Item Properties button on the toolbar.

  6. The Properties dialog displays the properties of the selected item in the source or target folder.

  7. Click <<Previous or Next>> to move to the Properties dialog for the next item selected.

    8. Tip: To see the properties for a single item, double-click the descriptor (for example, a file name or change request number) in the Source Description or Target Description column of the item pane.

To review references for a child folder or item:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Click a tab on the lower pane to display child folders or items of a specific type.

  4. Select a folder or item from the lower pane.

  5. Select Item > Item References. The <item> References dialog opens. Arrows point to the references for the item. Depending on whether the item is in one or both views, you will see one or two arrows. Note that the arrows for the source and target files are slightly different:

    6. An icon with an arrow pointing outward is used for a source item reference.

    An icon with an arrow pointing inward is used for a target item reference.

  6. Click OK.
